This bill would require the Fed to do its job and make sure our largest financial institutions are resilient to climate risks to avoid a financial crisis.

https://t.co/ucidqR1Tt6

1197353977802895365.text: Financial stability is part of the Fed’s mandate, and regulators in other countries are already working to quantify and manage climate risks. Why is the Fed lagging behind?

1197353973004619776.text: Banks face the risk of direct losses from climate change, not just in the distant future but now. But, like the housing bubble in 2007, our regulators are ignoring these risks.

1197353967828779009.text: Climate change lowers labor productivity, stresses farm output, hurts property values, and disrupts supply chains. No part of our economy will be spared.

1197353965173825536.text: Climate change is a major risk we are ignoring. It is increasing severe floods and wildfires, driving sea level rise and dangerous heat waves. These events are happening more often and causing more damage. These events hurt the economy.

1197353952842571776.text: When we ignore risks in our financial system, we risk a crisis that harms the whole economy and wipes out household wealth, as we saw in 2008.

1197353930864414720.text: THREAD: Here’s how our new climate stress test bill can help preserve our financial future ⬇️

344570239826153474.text: Today, #KingKamehamehaDay, Senator Schatz delivered a major floor speech urging equal treatment for Native Hawaiians. http://t.co/7M7QmyPzg4

344462714707513345.text: That is why today - on Kamehameha Day - I call upon all of us to join in the fight for justice for Native Hawaiians.

344462630695612417.text: It is long past time for the Native Hawaiian people to regain their right to self-governance.

344462487913132032.text: Separate is not equal, and that is why I urge the federal government to treat Native Hawaiians fairly.

344462328772833282.text: ...data reveals persistent health, education, and income disparities.

344462288964706304.text: Although Congress has passed more than 150 statutes to address negative effects of earlier federal actions...

344462011813466112.text: ...to provide a process for reorganizing a Native Hawaiian governing entity.

344461960584261632.text: It has been 20 years since the Apology Resolution, but the federal government has not yet acted...

344461869169397760.text: In 1993, the Congress passed, and President Clinton signed, the Apology Resolution, a formal acknowledgement and apology.

344461773056913410.text: Congress has consistently recognized Native Hawaiians as native peoples on whose behalf it may exercise its powers

344460812418691072.text: Native Hawaiian children were punished for speaking Hawaiian, just as American Indians and Alaska Natives were...

344460535477194754.text: These policies were as harmful and unjust to Native Hawaiians as they were to Alaska Natives and American Indians.

344460444272046080.text: For almost two centuries federal policies of removal, relocation, assimilation & termination decimated Native communities

344460089542975488.text: Native Hawaiians...deserve access to the prevailing federal policy of self-determination.

344459709555802115.text: I chose this day to come to the Floor to talk about an issue of great importance: Native Hawaiian government reorganization.

344459589326094338.text: “Mr. President, June 11th marks a public holiday in the State of Hawaii – King Kamehameha Day...
